Function Documentation

◆ detectMagnet()

bool detectMagnet ( AMS_5600 &  encoder,
const int  mux 
)

Checks whther the encoder is under the influence of a magnetic field (i.e. is there a magnet in range?)

Parameters
encoderAn object representing the AS5600 encoder we want to read from.
muxThe file descriptor used to communicate with the mux on the I2C bus.
Returns
true if a magnetic field is detected, false otherwise.

Definition at line 136 of file wind_mux.cpp.

void encoderInit ( AMS_5600 &  encoder,
const std::string  bus,
const int  mux 
)

Initialise an AS5600 encoder.

Parameters
encoderAn object representing the AS5600 encoder we want to read from.
busThe string identifier for the I2C bus, see Linux kernel documentation.
muxThe file descriptor used to communicate with the mux on the I2C bus.
Returns
true if a magnetic field is detected, false otherwise.

Definition at line 150 of file wind_mux.cpp.

◆ getAngle()

double getAngle ( AMS_5600 &  encoder,
const int  mux 
)

Fetch an angle between 0 and 360 degrees from the encoder. Used here to ascertain wind direction.

Parameters
encoderAn object representing the AS5600 encoder we want to read from.
muxThe file descriptor used to communicate with the mux on the I2C bus.
Returns
The current angle between the magnet and the encoder.

Definition at line 108 of file wind_mux.cpp.

◆ getSpeed()

int getSpeed ( AMS_5600 &  encoder,
const int  mux 
)

Fetch the rotational speed of the magnet over the encoder. Used here to ascertain wind speed.

Parameters
encoderAn object representing the AS5600 encoder we want to read from.
muxThe file descriptor used to communicate with the mux on the I2C bus.
Returns
The current angle between the magnet and the encoder.

Definition at line 122 of file wind_mux.cpp.

◆ init_mux()

int init_mux ( std::string  bus)

Initialises the multiplexer on the I2C bus. If the initialisation fails then the node will shut down.

Parameters
busThe string identifier for the I2C bus, see Linux kernel documentation.
Returns
A file descriptor which can be used to access the multiplexer.

◆ select_channel()

bool select_channel ( const uint8_t  channel,
const int  fd 
)

Selects a given channel on the multiplexer and delays to allow time for channel selection to take place.

Will print a message to stdout if the channel selection fails.

Parameters
channelThe channel (0 - 7) to read from.
fdThe file descriptor used to communicate with the mux on the I2C bus.
Note
This function does not return any value despite its return type.
